alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Moose Creek near Glennallen. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring in low-lying and poor drainage areas due to snowmelt. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 PM AKDT, Emergency management reported rapid snowmelt is causing minor flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing especially near Moose Creek. Above average snowpack combined with warming temperatures in mid May will continue to produce minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
